name: renealmia
flower-description: Flowers are in a terminal cluster, each with 3-lobed tubular calyx and 3 waxy petals (white, yellow, pink, or red).
leaf-description: Leaves are in two ranks on a reed-like stem.
poison-symptoms: CAUSES ONLY LOW TOXICITY IF EATEN. SKIN IRRITATION MINOR OR LASTING ONLY FOR A FEW MINUTES. Poisonous through ingestion or dermatitis. (Poison parts: Leaves, stems, roots). Symptoms may include skin and eye irritations upon contact with cell sap; cardiac effects upon ingestion.
